jobs.heading: Imaging summer trainees to software team
jobs.descr:
Imagine yourself working for AAC for the summer 2022!

We are looking for IMAGING SUMMER TRAINEES to join our software team in Tampere! 

AAC Technologies (AAC) is researching, developing and manufacturing leading edge solutions to enhance user experience of smart mobile devices. AAC's product lines can be found in smartphones and portable electronic devices across the world. AAC is investing in research and manufacturing to power future smart devices, and bring optimized high performance of smartphone solutions to a wide range of connected devices.

AAC Imaging Solutions in Tampere is developing next generation hardware and software solutions for mobile, automotive and other consumer and industrial applications. Our team is a diverse mixture of experience and enthusiasm. We're always looking for passionate professionals to join our team. Our values ‚Äì professional, open & inclusive ‚Äì tell a lot about how we see and treat each other.

What we offer to our summer trainees
‚Ä¢	Opportunity to work with a world-class talented team that is leading the Imaging area
‚Ä¢	Flat organization with a family-like feeling and relaxed atmosphere
‚Ä¢	A high-quality working environment with modern work practices ‚Äì awarded with Great Place to Work certificate.
‚Ä¢	Flexible working hours and flexible remote/on-site working hours. 
‚Ä¢	Competitive Salary
‚Ä¢	No micro-management ‚Äì we trust people to do their job
‚Ä¢	Great location at the historical Finlayson area in Tampere city center 

Job responsibilities
You would be working on some of these areas, depending on your skills and interest:

Algorithm optimization for GPU:
* You would speed-up the novel image processing algorithms utilizing GPU and parallel processing
* Key task: port C-implemented algorithm to GPU using CUDA framework to be used within Matlab environment

Image color processing and analyzing tool development:
* You would be developing software tools for image color processing, tuning and analysis.
* Key task: Develop user friendly tool with GUI for existing Matlab color processing algorithms, and develop/improve the algorithms

Imaging laboratory measurements: 
* You would be working with imaging measurements in laboratory using spectrometers, robots, light sources, etc.
* Key task: Capture, process and analyze the data and create reports using the high quality imaging laboratory

If you are interest in any of the above mentioned area, please send the application.


Qualifications
You can be studying for example Computer Sciences, Electrical Engineering, or Signal Processing
You have enthusiasm about photography, image quality, imaging systems and image processing in general.
You have some basic knowledge of the tools like Python, C#, GIT, Matlab, C/C++, depending on the project.

We appreciate analytical and critical thinking and problem-solving skills.
You need to have strong written and verbal communication skills in English to be able to fully enjoy our international and multi-cultural work environment.

For more information about the position, please contact Jere Tuulkari, jeretuulkari@aactechnologies.com.

Apply for the summer trainee position by sending your application & CV to jeretuulkari@aactechnologies.com at the latest on 10.4.2022. We will start browsing for the applicants immediately so do not hesitate in applying.

Interviews will be held during weeks 15 and 16 and the final decision to be made as soon as possible after that. The aim is to get the summer trainees starting at the latest on 1.6.2022. The employment will be fixed-term until the end of August / mid-September. Salary will be approximately 2500 ‚Ç¨/month.

For more information about us, please check our webpage: 
AAC Technologies

jobs.heading: Senior Growth Marketer
jobs.descr:
Are you already an experienced digital marketer? Are you thirsting for new challenges? Do you get the most out of yourself in an environment that encourages, empowers, and always accelerates? Join us and manage our diverse and interesting B2B customer projects!¬†

About this role üíõ

In this mission, you will dive deep into B2B clients‚Äô businesses from the beginning. You will develop new ways to make marketing a key source of revenue for your client together with your own team of experts. You will:

Design, implement and develop growth marketing projects for our ambitious B2B clients in different industries
Lead a team of marketing experts at The F Company
Support your customers‚Äô day-to-day marketing activities such as marketing strategy development, project management, campaign planning, and optimization¬†
Proactively grow your digital marketing knowledge and skills through continuous learning¬†
What we expect from you üî•

We want to support you in your new role as well as we can. These things will help you succeed:

3+ years of experience in digital marketing. You understand how things work ‚Äì from big picture strategy, to day-to-day execution
Strong experience with project management and team management
Excellent oral communication skills in English (Finnish is a plus)
Ability to design and execute controlled marketing experiments according to the customer‚Äôs brand, goals, data, and target audience
What we offer you üöÄ

No ordinary nine-to-five: we offer flexible working hours and the freedom to make decisions about your own work¬†
In a marketing office, the environment can sometimes be fast-paced, but it doesn‚Äôt have to be excessively so. We maintain an atmosphere where recovery is possible as well as encouraged,¬† and we also support the development of your skills.¬†
Opportunities to implement ideas outside of your official job description ‚Äì we want your daily work to remain interesting in the long run, too.¬†
‚Ç¨4500+ month, depending on your experience
Good opportunities for advancement as well as great benefits such as a monthly study budget, occupational health care, sports and cultural benefits. Plus, you get to dedicate a part of your weekly work time to learning something completely new!¬†
In your work, you are supported by amazing colleagues, and now our coffee is also very appealing.¬†
Send your application letter and CV with a salary request to careers@thefcompany.com as soon as possible, but no later than 3.4, as we will process applications as the application period progresses!

jobs.descr:
KOKENUT KIRJANPIT√ÑJ√Ñ / EXPERIENCED ACCOUNTANT

Colombier Finland Oy mullistaa elintarvikepakkaamista tarjoamalla ekologisen vaihtoehdon muoville. Colombier EcoBarrier‚Ñ¢ -teknologiallamme p√§√§llystetyt paperi- ja kartonkipakkaukset antavat veden, vesih√∂yryn ja rasvan kest√§v√§n suojan ilman muovikalvoa. Etsimme kasvavaan tiimiimme kokenutta kirjanpit√§j√§√§ edellisen siirtyess√§ toisiin teht√§viin yhti√∂n ulkopuolelle. Teht√§v√§t sis√§lt√§v√§t p√§ivitt√§isen kirjanpidon teht√§vi√§, osallistumista kuunvaihteen sulkemisiin, osto- ja myyntireskontran pitoa sek√§ muita hallinnollisia teht√§vi√§. Olemme my√∂s siirtym√§ss√§ vuoden sis√§√§n uuteen ERP-j√§rjestelm√§√§n, joten arvostamme suuresti kokemusta erilaisissa j√§rjestelm√§ymp√§rist√∂iss√§ toimimisesta sek√§ kokemusta j√§rjestelm√§vaihdoksista.

Tarjoamme monipuolisen ja mielenkiintoisen ty√∂n voimakkaasti kasvavan liiketoiminnan parissa. Teht√§v√§ on kokoaikainen ja tarjoamme oikealle kandidaatille vakituisen ty√∂suhteen. Toimenkuva edellytt√§√§ sujuvaa asiointia suomeksi ja englanniksi. Ty√∂t√§ voi tehd√§ hybridimallilla eli osin et√§n√§ ja osin paikan p√§√§ll√§ Pyht√§√§ll√§. Tarve aloitukselle on v√§litt√∂m√§sti.

L√§het√§ englanninkielinen CV:si palkkatoiveineen osoitteella rekry@colombier.com. Lis√§tietoja antaa General Manager Jani Puroranta +358505179992 tai jani.puroranta@colombier.com. 
 -----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Colombier Finland Oy is reshaping the food packaging industry by offering an alternative to plastic. Paper and paperboard packages made by using our Colombier EcoBarrier‚Ñ¢ technology provide a water, water vapour, and grease proof protection without a plastic film. Consequently, our packages are biodegradable and 100% recyclable as paper waste. Our production facility is located in Pyht√§√§ alongside the beautiful Kymi river in the historic factory environment of Stockfors. We are part of the international Colombier Group with >20 MEUR annual turnover. 

We are looking for an experienced accountant to join our team as our current accountant is transferring to another position outside the group.  The tasks include daily bookkeeping, participating in month end closings, AP and AR entries, and other administrative tasks. We are transferring into a new ERP system within a year and hence we greatly appreciate experience in working in diverse software environments and experience with changeover to new systems. 

We offer a versatile and interesting working environment within a rapidly growing business. The position is full-time and for the right candidate we offer a permanent position. We expect you to have good spoken and written English as the Group‚Äôs official working language is English. Our day-to-day office language is Finnish. The job can be performed in a hybrid model i.e. partly remotely and partly by being present at our facility in Pyht√§√§. The need for the start is immediate.


Please submit your CV and salary request in English at rekry@colombier.com. For more information, please contact General Manager Jani Puroranta +358505179992 or jani.puroranta@colombier.com .

Would you like to work in a youthful and professional group that has a great team spirit?

jobs.heading: Fundraisers and Team leader Needed
jobs.descr:
We're looking for fundraisers for several of our teams in the capital region of Helsinki, Espoo Vantaa! The chain of help starts with the donor, come and help by getting more monthly donors 

We're waiting for you to join our happy and relaxed team. We have a job that can't be matched, a job that doesn't get off easy, but gives even more. As a Feissar, or F2F fundraiser, your job is to actively approach people on the doors and convince them to join organizations we represent as monthly donors 

Your contribution is very important, as with the help of monthly donors we ensure that we get help both at home and around the world. 

At the moment we are looking for feissars in the following cities


Vaasa 


Helsinki


Espoo


Vantaa


What we wish for a feissar 
From you, we expect a fair and positive mind, perseverance and perseverance. Your job is to give a face and a voice to the organization and tell everyone about our work. 

At work, it is important to have the Courage to be bold in contact with people, to explain things convincingly and to make the customer feel that even the smallest act is Meaningful. In this way, we will have new monthly donors, with which our good work will continue. 

A positive and open attitude will take you a long way!
What we offerFlexible working hours: Shifts can be worked from Monday to Saturday,
3-6 shifts per week, evening hours. You can influence your own working days and working hours. (4hrs a day)
You have the opportunity to work on at doors
Competitive salary: We offer a salary of 12.50‚Ç¨/h for feissar, 13.50‚Ç¨/h for the team leader. In addition, we pay a 9% holiday bonus .
Temporary employment offer could become with time: Our new employment contracts are, in principle, Temporary, unless the matter is agreed separately with the employee. Summer working towns on a fixed-term basis, with possible extensions to be permanent.
As an employee of the Nordic Promotions, we take priority in making sure our workers are working in a stable environment. 
Support and training: You are supported by experienced coordinators and team leaders to get on board well and receive comprehensive, continuous training. You learn a lot about yourself as a turn influencer and you can also develop your existing interaction skills. This work teaches you even if you have a long and extensive work and life experience behind you.
Don't waste time.
Apply now at info@nordicpromotions.fi
We look foward to hearing from you

jobs.heading: Logistiikkaoperaattori - logistics operator for Microsoft
jobs.company_name: NRG Finland Nordic Retail Group Oy
jobs.descr:
Our customer, Microsoft looking for a 3 shift Logistics operator to work in the HoloLens team in Espoo.

Microsoft HoloLens is transforming the ways people communicate, create, and collaborate through the devices and components we develop. We‚Äôre a growing production team of Nanofabrication on a mission to develop revolutionary designs and ship first-to-market products. Our team is creative and resourceful, Microsoft value growth and learning. We want to amplify our abilities so you can do your best work. 
Working with Microsoft HoloLens will give you the opportunity to be with an organization which consists of professionals from the field of optics, micro- and nanofabrication process technologies, and mechanical engineering.

Tasks:
‚Ä¢	Perform task assign by the supervisor. 
‚Ä¢	Perform to take care of in and out bound of products, goods, raw materials both physically and in the data system of the warehouse. 
‚Ä¢	Inventory of the warehouse.
‚Ä¢	Proper safe packing for outgoing goods and prepare the shipment. 
‚Ä¢	Making sure assigned equipment are running as they should, with impactful output. 
Ability to follow detailed work instructions and execute.
‚Ä¢	With care follow manufacturing processes flow & provide constructive feedback.
‚Ä¢	Besides regular production there is excellent opportunity to work with exciting future products (R&D). 

Requirements:
‚Ä¢	Soft skills like: Motivated, Team player, Growth mindset and great communication in a multicultural environment. 
‚Ä¢	Hard skills:
o	Either candidate has a manufacturing experience (macro or nanofabrication related is a plus) 
Or 
o	Candidate has a relevant and appropriate technical education, Bachelor level education from Engineering/Industry / Nanofabrication/ Logistics is a plus. 
Or
o	Candidate has worked with some sort of logistics or warehouse. 

‚Ä¢	Ability to use basic Microsoft office applications. 
‚Ä¢	Basic understanding/ experience of chemical handling is a plus. 
‚Ä¢	Good hand-eye coordination as this job is related to nanofabrication.
‚Ä¢	Ability to work in three shift rotation system in the clean room lab (Morning-Night-Evening/week).

The person will be employed for NRG on a fixed-term contract, first contract period until Dec 31st then extended, total length of 18 months.
Start date: April 
Location: Espoo or Vantaa
Monthly salary: 3000 euros

About Nordic Retail Group 
Nordic Retail Group is a full-service retail agency, founded in 1997 and is represented in all four Nordic countries. We focus on helping our clients build their brands and reach their goals by offering staffing, recruitment, creative studio, and innovative inventions for our clients. We have built a strong team and we know what‚Äôs needed for a brand to succeed in retail, and how to increase sales both locally and globally. 
The work environment at Nordic Retail Group is creative and energetic and we‚Äôre always eager to go the extra mile to succeed. We truly have a passion for people, that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important for us to offer the most safe, inclusive, and inspiring workplace that we possibly can for our amazing employees. 
 
We highly value having a diverse team with different types of experiences and backgrounds included in the mix. It‚Äôs important to us that everyone feels valued, appreciated and like an important part of our team. Most importantly, we want our staff to love coming to work. Like our founders always says: ‚ÄúYou should not only whistle on your way home from the office ‚Äì but also on your way to the office.‚Äù 
 
Visit our website www.nordicretailgroup.com for more information.

jobs.heading: Summer lab operators for Microsoft Espoo
jobs.company_name: NRG Finland Nordic Retail Group Oy
jobs.descr:
For Microsoft we are looking for 3 and 5 shift Summer Lab operators  May-Sept

The Microsoft HoloLens hardware team is transforming the ways people communicate, create, and collaborate through the devices and components we develop. We‚Äôre growing our team on a mission to develop revolutionary designs and ship first-to-market products. Our team is creative and resourceful; we value growth and learning. We want to amplify your abilities, so you can do your best work. 
Join us, and together we‚Äôll turn groundbreaking hardware designs into reality!
 
Job description:
‚Ä¢	Making sure assigned equipment are running as they should, with impactful output.
‚Ä¢	Ability to follow detailed work instructions and execute.
‚Ä¢	Operate the assigned advanced equipment to create optical components with attention and focus.
‚Ä¢	With care follow manufacturing processes flow & provide constructive feedback.
‚Ä¢	Besides regular production there is excellent opportunity to work with exciting future products (R&D). 
‚Ä¢	Perform to operate chemicals & machines for production. 
‚Ä¢	Performing according to the demands like; follow priority, multitasking and cooperative. 
‚Ä¢	Understanding repetitive error and sort the repetition error to continue production. 
‚Ä¢	Communicate in and across the teams with impact. 

Candidate requirements:
‚Ä¢	Positive mindset and attitude
‚Ä¢	Motivated to do routine work
‚Ä¢	Quick to learn
‚Ä¢	Team player, Growth mindset 
‚Ä¢	great communication in a multicultural environment: English language mandatory
‚Ä¢	Detail-oriented and precise in her/his work
‚Ä¢	Laboratory work experience is a big advantage 
‚Ä¢	Cleanroom experience: Not mandatory, but is valued
‚Ä¢	manufacturing experience (macro or nanofabrication related is a plus)
‚Ä¢	Interest in STEM is an advantage
‚Ä¢	Chemical knowledge: Some basic level huge advantage
‚Ä¢	eye to details and good eye-hand coordination
‚Ä¢	Candidate has a relevant and appropriate technical education. Bachelor level education from Engineering/Chemistry/Industry related/ Nanofabrication/ IT related is a plus. 
‚Ä¢	able to commit to given shifts 



Hourly salary: between 19,10 - 21 eur + extras according to Teknologia teollisuus TES
Location: Espoo (advantage if you have a car of your own)
Start: as agreed in May
End: max Sept 30th

Apply:
The selection of applicants is ongoing, so apply now via our web form. 
Questions about the service can be addressed to Mari Torstila, torstila@nordicretailgroup.com
Please note that we will start interviews as soon as possible, so register on our website with application, CV in English and arguments why you would be the best possible candidate for this assignment. 

About Nordic Retail Group
Nordic Retail Group is a full-service retail agency, founded in 1997 and is represented in all four Nordic countries. We focus on helping our clients build their brands and reach their goals by offering staffing, recruitment, creative studio, and innovative inventions for our clients. We have built a strong team and we know what‚Äôs needed for a brand to succeed in retail, and how to increase sales both locally and globally. 
The work environment at Nordic Retail Group is creative and energetic and we‚Äôre always eager to go the extra mile to succeed. We truly have a passion for people, that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important for us to offer the most safe, inclusive, and inspiring workplace that we possibly can for our amazing employees. 
 
We highly value having a diverse team with different types of experiences and backgrounds included in the mix. It‚Äôs important to us that everyone feels valued, appreciated and like an important part of our team. Most importantly, we want our staff to love coming to work. Like our founders always says: ‚ÄúYou should not only whistle on your way home from the office ‚Äì but also on your way to the office.‚Äù 
 
Visit our website www.nordicretailgroup.com for more information.

jobs.heading: Finnish Speaking Fundamentals Analyst in Dublin
jobs.descr:
Are you interested in the financial industry and speak Finnish fluently? Then this might be the ideal opportunity to kick-start your career!


About us


Our partner provides end-to-end transformative services for its clients across the globe. The company‚Äôs integrated IT and BPM solutions approach enables it to unlock business value across industries and service lines, and address business challenges for its clients. Utilizing innovative business excellence frameworks, ongoing productivity improvements, process reengineering, automation, and cutting-edge technology platforms, the company¬†enables its clients to achieve their cost reduction objectives, improve process efficiencies, enhance effectiveness, and deliver superior customer experience. We have 35 delivery centers in 14 countries spread across 6 continents, with 42,000+ employees from over 80+ nationalities.


Overall Purpose of the Role:


This position is an excellent entry opportunity to gain a comprehensive understanding of the industry through financial reporting standards and enable you to learn facets of the assigned industry, as well as apply this knowledge to your daily responsibilities.


This role involves researching and analyzing company financial data for Fundamental‚Äôs product in support of the EMEA markets.


Key Responsibilities:



Research and analyze financial data from companies' annual/quarterly reports
Conduct company-specific financial research
Maintain, improve, and deliver accurate and high-quality information for the Client Terminal on a timely basis

Financial Data Processing Responsibilities:



Analyze and extract company performance data from financial statement like Balance Sheet, Income Statement & Cash flow statements of all the listed companies globally, both in English and Finnish
Standardize the data available in the Income statement, Balance Sheet, and Cash Flow statement in accordance with the collection policy
Work within various global accounting principles, GAAP, IFRS etc.

¬†


Essential: 



Bachelor‚Äôs Degree (or equivalent) in a relevant subject or relevant work experience


Fluent in English and Finnish
An understanding of the components of financial statements
Customer focus, Problem solver with excellent communication, interpersonal skills
Ability to prioritize tasks accordingly and work to tight and conflicting deadlines
Speed and accuracy when processing data with a high level of attention to detail

Desirable:



Advanced Excel Skills (lookups, pivot tables)

Benefits for you



Performance-related bonus
Tax Saver Scheme ‚Äì which allows for employees to purchase travel tickets/ bike tax-free
Health Insurance -¬†10% off a health insurance plan with Irish Life.
Company contribution pension scheme
Sick Pay ‚Äì Entitled to 6 days of sick leave per year after the probation period is passed.
2 days study leave
Access to an extensive variety of upskilling courses
Relocation support

About Us - Nordic Jobs Worldwide

We are a professional Nordic recruitment specialist focused on connecting candidates from Sweden, Finland, Norway, and Denmark with businesses from all over the world. Nordic Jobs Worldwide is the largest language Recruitment agency in the Nordic region, we match the most exciting jobs with Nordic talent. Over the past 3 years, we have recruited and helped close to 2000 Nordic speakers to their dream job with our partners in over 28 different countries.

jobs.heading: Machinist / Assembly work
jobs.descr:
There are two different job openings for the same company:
Machinist (CNC) and Assembly work (Production work)

Are you looking for a long-term job?

We are now looking for production workers (assembly work) and machinists (CNC-machinists) to work in the J√§rvenp√§√§ area in the metal industry. Our customer develops and manufactures electric forklifts as well as fully autonomous, self-propelled forklifts and automation solutions. This international company employs over 450 workers in Finland and over 10000 workers worldwide.

No Finnish language is needed for these jobs. English or Finnish is enough.

For production workers (assembly work)¬†

In this task, you work together with the staff of the assembly line, making sure the manufacture of the forklifts is in accordance with the planned production and quality objectives.

We wish from you:

Experience in mechanical or electrical installation work
Work experience in the car repair or similar field
Readiness for 3-shift work
English or Finnish is enough.
Teamwork skills
We offer you:¬†

Long-term employment. The working contract starts as a fixed term and it will continue automatically.
Modern facilities of a International company
Competitive salary
Be apart of an ever-growing company exporting Finnish technology to the world
For Machinist work:

We wish from you:

Previous experience in CNC machining
Readiness for 3-shift work
English or Finnish is enough.
We offer you:

Long-term employment. The working contract starts as a fixed term and it will continue automatically.
Modern facilities of a International high-tech company
Competitive salary
Be apart of an ever-growing company exporting Finnish technology to the world
It‚Äôs easy to apply for these jobs! Just send your CV and application to¬†wellpack@wellpack.fi. You can also apply for these jobs through our website.

Please let us know in the application which position you‚Äôre applying for, when you will be able to start work and how long you will be able to work.

If you need any more information about the job openings, call:
Mervi Parviainen, Phone number: +358 401 238 979, wellpack@wellpack.fi




We have people who really care

Wellpack Oy is a Finnish staffing and recruitment company founded in 2013. Our goal is to help our employees and customers succeed.¬†

As an employee, you are the most important and work is a valuable thing. We strive to provide the most stable work environment possible for every employee. We are ready to help our own employees flexibly according to their needs.

For Microsoft we are looking for Statistics/Quality systems Summer trainee May-Aug

The Microsoft HoloLens hardware team is transforming the ways people communicate, create, and collaborate through the devices and components we develop. We‚Äôre growing our team on a mission to develop revolutionary designs and ship first-to-market products. Our team is creative and resourceful; we value growth and learning. Join us, and together we‚Äôll turn groundbreaking hardware designs into reality!
 
Job description/Tasks:
‚Ä¢	Develop process controls by following SPC (Statistical Process Control) practices and local tools

‚Ä¢	Updating existing documentation and instructions, if needed

Candidate requirements:
‚Ä¢	Good knowledge of statistics, SPC knowledge is an advantage
‚Ä¢	Systematic data analysis skills and ability to write scientific reports

‚Ä¢	Fluent English is required, Finnish is not mandatory for this position

‚Ä¢	Electronics or Data/Information Science or relevant

Monthly salary: approx. 3200 eur, will be confirmed after interviews

Start:  May 2nd
End: August 31st

Please note that we will start interviews as soon as possible, so register on our website with application, CV in English and arguments why you would be the best possible candidate for this assignment. 

About Nordic Retail Group
Nordic Retail Group is a full-service retail agency, founded in 1997 and is represented in all four Nordic countries. We focus on helping our clients build their brands and reach their goals by offering staffing, recruitment, creative studio, and innovative inventions for our clients. We have built a strong team and we know what‚Äôs needed for a brand to succeed in retail, and how to increase sales both locally and globally. 
The work environment at Nordic Retail Group is creative and energetic and we‚Äôre always eager to go the extra mile to succeed. We truly have a passion for people, that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important for us to offer the most safe, inclusive, and inspiring workplace that we possibly can for our amazing employees. 
 
We highly value having a diverse team with different types of experiences and backgrounds included in the mix. It‚Äôs important to us that everyone feels valued, appreciated and like an important part of our team. Most importantly, we want our staff to love coming to work. Like our founders always says: ‚ÄúYou should not only whistle on your way home from the office ‚Äì but also on your way to the office.‚Äù 
 
Visit our website www.nordicretailgroup.com for more information.

jobs.heading: Business designer and developer
jobs.descr:
Assignment for writing a basic, preliminary or elementary business plan.
¬†
I'm looking for someone who could write a preliminary business plan for my ICT project, as a CP injury prevents me from using a computer keyboard.
¬†
As my mother tongue is not Finnish but Farsi (Persian), I am not able to write documents written in a matter-of-fact manner in a sufficiently correct language.
¬†
The business plan required for financiers must be written in Finnish, as unfortunately English cannot be used. I speak Finnish slowly, but I think fast and creatively. I act like others cognitively. The business plan is ‚Äúpreliminary‚Äù in nature and is 5-13 pages long (A4).
¬†
The business plan describes how to turn the Fassment concept into a Start Up product development project.
¬†
My business plan includes the following Subheadings:
¬†
1) the starting point of the development idea, 2) the idea of ‚Äã‚Äãthe product and service concept, 3) the vision, 4) the competitor and partner analysis, 5) the target group analysis, 6) the marketing plan, 7) the risk analysis, the financing plan, 9) the profitability calculation and 10) the SWOT analysis .
I also need a 1 page summary.
¬†
Business plan writing work could be implemented in the following ways:
¬†
The author gets acquainted with the source material in English and extracts the material in connection with subheadings 1‚Äì10. After grouping the material, the translation work from English to Finnish follows. Naturally, we discuss text choices, for example, remotely (Teams, Zoom).
¬†
The writing of a business plan would be suitable for a free lancer assignment for a student in computer science, business or behavioral sciences, as well as a media student who is familiar with the topic of the project.
¬†
I am willing to pay a reasonable writing fee for writing a business-like 5-13 page Finnish business plan.
The total budget for this business plan at the introductory or elementary level is currently ‚Ç¨ 800. Of course, up to 1500Euros is possible. I have also used the help of a journalist to write this announcement.
¬†
--
¬†
Very respectfully/
Ali Alizadeh.
¬†
Founder and global chairman of board of the directors at Fassment Inc
¬†

jobs.heading: Lead Discipline Engineer, piping
jobs.descr:
We provide solutions for a better tomorrow.

Are you looking for a new challenge that combines your technical skills with the enthusiastic of collaboration?¬†Do you enjoy work with versatile projects in developing plant environment? We are looking for a self-driven and motivated Piping Discipline Engineer for our Technical Development & Engineering team in Porvoo, Finland.

You will be part of Technical Development & Engineering team who is responsible of project studies, engineering and execution for our plants in Porvoo. As a Piping discipline engineering engineer you will co-operate with study leaders, project managers, engineering partner and group specialist. You will ensure that the project piping is completed on quality and schedule and within budget. You will also have possibility to participate development of our engineering tools.

As an our Piping Discipline Engineer, these will be your main tasks:¬†



To be responsible of detailed engineering and execution for smaller sized piping projects
Co-operation with project studies to draft sketch and estimate cost and schedule of piping discipline
Guide, comment and supervise engineering partner in large projects execution and participate engineering reviews
Develop and Maintain specifications within group network
Supervision of piping installations during turnaround (major overhaul)¬†


About you

To¬†be able to start this journey, you hold a relevant B.Sc/M.Sc degree in Mechanical Engineering or equivalent by expertise and preferable min. 5 years of experience in the piping and layout engineering, practical site or production plant background appreciated.

Other preferred skills are:



Experience of relevant standards, such as EN, ASME and API standards.
Knowledge of Pressure Equipment Directive (PED) and legislation related chemical piping and material know-how
2D and 3D engineering tools experience for instance Autocad, Aveva, SmartPlant


We wish you to be an initiative person who have a strong motivation to cooperate successfully with others in a team. You have courage to make decisions by yourself and¬†prioritising and leading your own work is familiar for you. We hope you already have some experience of handling projects sustainably by involving and engaging others to do their best.¬†As we are working in multicultural working environment and you being the contact person between different stakeholders, you should be a fluent communicator in Finnish and in English.

In Borealis, safety is priority number one, so you have a strong focus to proactively promote and drive the health, safety and environmental awareness and behaviour. To achieve the best results in this position, you will also need analytical thinking skills and you are capable to network fluently. Active attitude to have an impact and influence for ongoing matters will help you to raise your professional growth.

About Borealis and our offer

We offer you a competitive reward package and possibility to achieve your career and personal goals, which enables you to have more meaningful and balanced life. As a growing, international and innovative company, we would love to spark your curiosity to join us on our quest to create relevant solutions that also help our planet. ¬†We are also proud to mention that we are having very inspiring and developing environment where all experienced professionals work together enjoying the support and respect of the others.¬†

The position will be located in Kilpilahti industrial area in Porvoo, around 30 minutes away from Helsinki city by car. Borealis also offers bus transportation for our employees from Helsinki and Porvoo and the surrounding areas.

We are here for you!¬†For any questions about this position or working in Borealis, please do not hesitate to contact our Engineering Manager, Ville-Veikko Kylli√§inen, tel. ¬†+358 50 3794 559

Do you feel enthusiastic about this role after reading this opening?¬†Please apply online and upload your CV and cover letter already today! Applications are processed actively throughout the search period, so we are eagerly waiting for you to apply! The latest day to apply is¬†24.4.2022.¬†

Borealis is one of the world‚Äôs leading providers of advanced and circular polyolefin solutions and a European market leader in base chemicals, fertilizers and the mechanical recycling of plastics. We leverage our polymers expertise and decades of experience to offer value adding, innovative and circular material solutions for key industries. In re-inventing for more sustainable living, we build on our commitment to safety, our people and excellence as we accelerate the transformation to a circular economy and expand our geographical footprint.¬†www.borealisgroup.com¬†|¬†www.borealiseverminds.com¬†|¬†careers.borealisgroup.com

We go beyond boundaries. Together.

jobs.heading: Suomenkielinen Account Strategist Barcelonaan
jobs.descr:
We are looking for a Finnish speaking Account Strategist to work with Google Ads Products in Barcelona!
¬†
Description:

Are you a Google fan? Do you love Google products? Are you passionate about the web and new technology?

If you are tech-savvy, creative, outgoing, and willing to roll up your sleeves and get things done in a fast-paced, rapidly changing environment, we may have the perfect job for you!

We are currently seeking Account Strategist (with native level of Finnish) to join our growing company in Barcelona.


Responsibilities:


As an Agency Account Strategist, your role is to identify and apply the appropriate advertising solutions through an active collaboration with Media, Digital Marketing, and Online Advertising Agency Partners. You work with a wide variety of advertisers, and deliver the optimal digital advertising solution for each customer.



Implement creative ways to improve our Agency relationships, tailor and share performance-enhancing suggestions, and upsell or promote other Google products.
Provide strategic advice and help Agencies get the best ROI on their clients‚Äô advertising investment by working closely with them in a consultative role.
Consistently deliver against assigned quota, while prioritizing and delivering outstanding customer sales experience to Media Agencies.
Communicate with Agencies proactively, via phone and email.

Requirements:

BA/BS degree or equivalent practical experience.
Native level of Finnish
Ability to speak and write English fluently and idiomatically.
Strong presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills

Desirable:



Knowledge of Google products such as Ads, AdSense or YouTube A team player with strong leadership, analytical and communication skills. Passionate about Marketing, technology and online Advertising, with a desire to learn and develop
Strong presentation, analytical and problem-solving skills
0-1 Years of experience in digital marketing, preferably building and optimizing PPC Campaigns

Benefits

Full-time position (39h per week, Monday to Friday)
Long Term Contract
Relocation Package:

Flight Ticket
Accommodation

3 weeks of intense introduction training on Google Ads and specific sales training.
A permanent presence of coaches who will facilitate your personal and professional development
Established career path to grow within the project
Continuous training and certifications within Google products
Bi-weekly, monthly, or quarterly contests
Employment with the world's largest provider of contact center services
Excellent work environment, great colleagues, social arrangements, and personal development
Dynamic business casual environment with colleagues of all ages gathered in a highly motivated team



About us¬†


We are a professional recruitment agency focusing on the Nordic languages and our main goal is to expertly employ jobseekers from Finland, Sweden, Norway, and Denmark to international companies around the world.


Nordic Jobs Worldwide is the largest recruitment company in the Nordic countries - we match the most exciting jobs with Nordic talent. Over the past two years, we have recruited more than 1,000 Nordic speakers to our client companies in more than 28 different countries.

jobs.heading: F2F Fundraiser at UNICEF
jobs.descr:
We are looking for Fundraisers to join our teams in Helsinki, Kuopio, Jyv√§skyl√§, Tampere and Turku.
¬†
Why work as a F2F Fundraiser at UNICEF?



As a fundraiser you are a life saver. F2F fundraising is the most efficient channel for recruiting monthly donors for UNICEF. We recruit most of our monthly donors through our F2F Fundraisers. Monthly donors guarantee that every child everywhere in the world gets the vital help they need
UNICEF is the world's leading children's organization helping millions of children annually. With your work you help UNICEF vaccinate half of the children under the age of 5 world wide



What we offer you:



Part-time job with 16-19h/week, 4 shifts a week between Mon and Fri
Hourly pay of 12,33 euros
Sport and culture benefit
Occupational Health Care
Inspiring working atmosphere
Work contract valid for the time being
Regular training to support your work: you'll participate in work shops and department meetings to enhance your skills and stay up to date. The work starts with a paid training.
An opportunity to advance and create a career: our F2F Manager, Coordinators, Team Leaders and Team Assists have all started out as F2F Fundraisers. When you work for us, you will be able to advance along with your skills.



We expect that you:



Are able to work 4 shifts a week between Monday and Friday: working time varies from¬†9 and 21 o'clock (in Helsinki occasional week end work)
Have a target-oriented mind set to meet the fundraising goals
Have perseverance and ability to convince people
Have plenty of ambition to develop and advance
Are at least 18 years old
Are willing to travel around the city of employment to different fundraising sites



We have a motivating fundraising goal, so you'll always know how many children you and your team has helped. Please leave your application by clicking Apply. Due to GDPR reasons we don't handle applications sent via email.


Lue lis√§√§ suomeksi ja hae:

jobs.heading: Data and Content Product Owner
jobs.descr:
Voima‚Äôs financial markets unit‚ÄîVoima Markets‚Äîis looking for a person to take ownership of Voima‚Äôs finance- and economics-related data and content production. You enjoy working with data and producing quality content such as informative articles as well as in-depth research articles. You are hungry to learn more and willing to take responsibility over your work.

Position description

You will be responsible for gathering trustworthy sources to Voima‚Äôs finance and economics database, which you will build together with the help of Voima‚Äôs IT unit.
You will also write articles to Voima‚Äôs blog ranging from in-depth market research to informative articles and timely market commentaries.
We do not expect you to know everything about gold markets, but basic knowledge of finance and economics is a good start.
You will be supported by the seasoned financial markets experts found within Voima‚Äôs organisation.
In everything Voima does, trust is paramount‚Äîdata and written words are definitely no exception. Voima Markets aims to become the source of truth for gold research and data‚Äîtogether with the help of your colleagues, you will be responsible for achieving this.

This means producing high quality content to Voima‚Äôs Customers‚Äîfrom educating retail Customers on the basics of economics to providing cutting-edge insight to institutional Customers and channel partners. This requires selecting trustworthy and accurate sources of data as well as being able to go the extra mile to produce proprietary research and market commentaries that is in demand by people around the world.

If you have what it takes, you may find yourself either leading or playing a major role in Voima‚Äôs future team of researchers and content producers.

Is this you?

You

enjoy working with and processing data and are able to put data into a story form.
take pride in the fact that your data is always correct and are always looking to find the true underlying source of the data you use.
can take ownership over data accuracy and financial markets-related content production at Voima.
have some experience in processing data and writing content.
have an interest towards financial markets and global economics.
are hungry to learn more, eager to understand the true causal relations between events and willing to take responsibility for your work.
We are looking for a person who is eager to play their part in Voima‚Äôs mission, which is to create the safest bank by leading the change to gold-based financial services. When a job needs to be done, you want to get it done, even if it meant longer hours. You enjoy challenges, you are not afraid to fail and you understand that in order to succeed you must never give up.

Work environment

Voima Markets is responsible for Voima‚Äôs access to market and liquidity for precious metals, foreing exchange and credit as well as facilitating transactions on these markets. Also, refinery and trading partner relations, trading and hedging strategies as well as finance-related product development are managed by the unit. As a part of Voima Markets‚Äô strategy, the unit is looking to hire both young and enthusiastic finance-oriented people as well as experienced finance professionals‚Äîwhat they must have in common is a hard-working mentality and hunger to learn more.

Voima

is a burgeoning company, with a strong in-house staff, a solid investor base and Customers from over 60 countries.
is a great opportunity to have a lasting impact.

jobs.heading: Partnerships Manager
jobs.company_name: Helsinki Intl Film Festival ‚Äì Love & Anarchy ry
jobs.descr:
Partnerships Manager

As the partnerships manager, your area of work would entail the entirety of the organisation: the Love & Anarchy film festival, Finnish Film Affair, Season Film Festival, the Tour, and other HIFF happenings. The partnerships manager has an important role in strengthening the organisation‚Äôs brand, increasing financial resources, and networking. You will maintain and plan the association‚Äôs commercial partnerships, do partnership sourcing, and network and participate in event production. You will also be in charge of selling advertisement space for the organisation‚Äôs events and publications. We are currently renewing our partnership strategy, so you will have a hand in planning cooperation and marketing concepts. Depending on the skills of the person hired, the job will also involve creating and implementing a commercial marketing plan for our public events, from outdoor advertising to media releases.¬†

Your work will be strongly guided by the organisation‚Äôs mission to celebrate the art of cinema and heal the world through love and anarchy, and our core values of ambition, diversity, courage and kindness. You want to be part of building an inspiring, equal, accessible and sustainable film culture and you see these goals as opportunities for inspiring and productive commercial partnerships. You will work in close cooperation with the communications team and the organisation‚Äôs head, as well as closely with the programme coordinator, producer and the head of Finnish Film Affair.

The person we are looking for has:

solid experience and understanding of the nature of festival and event work; they enjoy the occasional hectic pace, and can cope with pressure
a proven track record of working with corporate partnerships, B2B sales and commercial conceptualisation
experience in event marketing
networking skills, and good communication and teamwork skills
project and budget management skills
a genuine interest and enthusiasm for film
a goal-oriented approach to work and a wealth of ideas
a drive to evolve and learn new skills
excellent oral and written Finnish and/or English language skills¬†
knowledge of the Finnish cultural and events scene and international expertise would be an advantage
Good to know:

the position includes at times, specifically during events, work during evenings and weekends
the organisation‚Äôs longer holiday period takes place at the end of the year; there is no opportunity to take long holidays in the summer as the organisation prepares for the L&A festival in early autumn¬†
occasional remote work is possible for part of the year, however mostly we work from our office in Helsinki
Employment is full-time from March to November and part-time (max. half-time, to be agreed separately) from December to February. The contract is fixed until 30.4.2024, with the possibility of an extension.
The salary offer is 2700‚Ç¨/month (full-time).

Read more about the position and us here: https://hiff.fi/en/news/2022/04/06/helsinki-iff-hiring-2022/

Hei sin√§ reipas henkil√∂kohtainen avustaja p√§√§kaupunkiseudulla!

jobs.heading: Mobile QA Automation Engineer (iOS)
jobs.descr:
About AlphaSense: 

AlphaSense is a market intelligence platform used by the world's leading companies and financial institutions. Since 2011, our AI-based technology has helped professionals make smarter business decisions by delivering insights from an extensive universe of public and private content - including company filings, event transcripts, news, trade journals, and equity research. Our platform is trusted by over 1,800 enterprise customers, including a majority of the S&P 500. Headquartered in New York City, AlphaSense employs over 450 people across offices in the US, UK, Finland, and India. For more information, please visit¬† www.alpha-sense.com . 

Check out what we've built so far: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=V5d2ELsTvkw AlphaSense culture:¬†¬†

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OvkCzvolyaY

 The role: 

We are seeking a Senior Quality Assurance Automation Engineer in our Mobile team to develop automated and manual tests for our state-of-the-art research engine in Mobile iOS application. You will join our engineering team of world-class software experts and be responsible for implementing, executing and measuring the automated testing of the AlphaSense product using Java, Appium, Selenium and scripting languages. You will work together with the team of Developers and Testers to ensure the overall functionality and quality of the software. 

What we are looking for:

A BS / MS degree in a relevant Technical Discipline such as Computer Science, Engineering or Information Technology
Experience setting up automated test frameworks and implementing tests for use cases along with the necessary reporting tools
Knowledge of tests Automation best practices and patterns
Understanding of test driven development and continuous delivery
Experience with an iterative Agile methodology and use of tools like JIRA, Wiki, Git, Maven, Jenkins
Strong Java (or Kotlin)
Experience in Appium
Passion for software testing and quality
Strong communication skills and the ability to work both in a team environment and independently


What we consider as a plus:

XCode
Selenium
CI / CD tools
SQL
Linux
Javascript
Cloud-based technologies (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Docker / Kubernetes
Knowledge of scripting languages ‚Äã‚Äãsuch as shell Scripts, Perl, Python


What we offer you in return:

Playing a part in the story of a fast growing company
Competitive compensation package
Interesting career opportunities and training
Very highly skilled colleagues
Tea, coffee and soft drinks at the office
Gym, game room, parking or public transport benefit
Hybrid work supported 100%¬†
Home internet and mobile phone
Lunch and recreational benefits
Occupational health care


You can apply by sending your cover letter and resume through the application form. 

If you have any questions, our QA Manager (Kalidass Rathinam) is happy to answer them by email via krathinam@alpha-sense.com

jobs.heading: Neko Izakaya: Restaurant Waiters / Waitresses (Tarjoilija)
jobs.descr:
Neko Izakaya is a Japanese-themed restaurant in the hip district of Kallio, Helsinki. We serve Japanese-inspired soul foods and cocktails.

We are looking for a competent and experienced Restaurant Server to take and deliver orders. You'll be the face of our restaurant and responsible for our customers' experiences. You need to be quick on your feet and have a polite and friendly attitude.
¬†
If you enjoy talking to people and thrive in a fast-paced workplace, we'd like to meet you. Your ultimate goal will be to provide high-quality service that will help us maintain and attract customers, and educate our customers about Japanese food and beverages. Applicants must be age 21 or above. 

Responsibilities



Take and serve orders, including alcoholic Beverages
Make cocktails (we'll train you)
Help with small kitchen tasks if needed
Deal with complaints or problems with a positive attitude

¬†
Skills



Fluent English
At least 1 year of restaurant serving experience with the ability to multitask
Excellent people skills with a friendly attitude
Bartending experience is a big plus
Finnish language is a plus

¬†
Job Type:
¬†



Part-time: approx. 30 hours/week
Working time: Wednesday to Saturday, 4pm to 11pm



Benefits:



Employee discount
Flexible schedule

jobs.heading: R&D Summer trainee for Microsoft May-Aug
jobs.company_name: NRG Finland Nordic Retail Group Oy
jobs.descr:
For Microsoft we are looking for R&D Summer trainee May-Aug
The Microsoft HoloLens hardware team is transforming the ways people communicate, create, and collaborate through the devices and components we develop. We‚Äôre growing our team on a mission to develop revolutionary designs and ship first-to-market products. Our team is creative and resourceful; we value growth and learning. We want to amplify your abilities, so you can do your best work. 
Join us, and together we‚Äôll turn groundbreaking hardware designs into reality!
 
Job description/Tasks:
‚Ä¢	Development of production technologies and process.
‚Ä¢	Development of the production processes documentation
‚Ä¢	Fabrication work in the clean room.
‚Ä¢	Identify and communicate any issues and improvement opportunities related to process

Candidate requirements:
‚Ä¢	Understanding of nanofabrication process is beneficial
‚Ä¢	Data analysis experience beneficial
‚Ä¢	JMP or MiniTab will be beneficial
‚Ä¢	cleanroom experience is an advantage
‚Ä¢	Fluent English is required, Finnish is not mandatory for this position
‚Ä¢	Physics, Chemistry or electrical engineering education background
‚Ä¢	Bachelor‚Äôs degree, Master degree or student of a Master program

Monthly salary: approx. 3200 eur, will be confirmed after interviews
Location: Espoo
Start:  May 2nd
End: August 31st

Apply:
The selection of applicants is ongoing, so apply now via our web form. 
Questions about the service can be addressed to Mari Torstila, torstila@nordicretailgroup.com
Please note that we will start interviews as soon as possible, so register on our website with application, CV in English and arguments why you would be the best possible candidate for this assignment. 

About Nordic Retail Group
Nordic Retail Group is a full-service retail agency, founded in 1997 and is represented in all four Nordic countries. We focus on helping our clients build their brands and reach their goals by offering staffing, recruitment, creative studio, and innovative inventions for our clients. We have built a strong team and we know what‚Äôs needed for a brand to succeed in retail, and how to increase sales both locally and globally. 
The work environment at Nordic Retail Group is creative and energetic and we‚Äôre always eager to go the extra mile to succeed. We truly have a passion for people, that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important for us to offer the most safe, inclusive, and inspiring workplace that we possibly can for our amazing employees. 
 
We highly value having a diverse team with different types of experiences and backgrounds included in the mix. It‚Äôs important to us that everyone feels valued, appreciated and like an important part of our team. Most importantly, we want our staff to love coming to work. Like our founders always says: ‚ÄúYou should not only whistle on your way home from the office ‚Äì but also on your way to the office.‚Äù 
 
Visit our website www.nordicretailgroup.com for more information.

jobs.heading: Junior Customer Success Manager, Finland/Nordics
jobs.descr:
Feedbackly is looking for a hard-working and motivated Junior Customer Success Manager to join our growing team in Finland. If you are ambitious to build great customer relationships, get excited about great products, love working in a startup, and want to be part of a team that creates a product that thousands of people will use ‚Äì you could be our next champion!



Feedbackly

Feedbackly is one of the leading SaaS solutions for omnichannel Customer Experience measurement, offering the best Emotional Experience ecosystem that provides also next-level solutions for leading growth through CX. As we build the world‚Äôs only software that turns CX into sales and customer loyalty through emotional understanding,¬†our vision is to revolutionize customer experiences on a global level.

As we grow both within the existing customer base and new customers, we also need team members to deliver on customer expectations and help them out with their day-to-day. Our Customer Success team is primarily responsible for helping new customers get onboarded and quickly find value with their Feedbackly accounts. In addition, the Customer Success team works with existing customers to ensure they‚Äôre optimizing Feedbackly to achieve their business goals with our Customer Experience solution. We operate at a global level with team members across the world, and this person would join the team in our HQ in Helsinki, Finland. If you enjoy interacting with customers and helping them solve their issues while exceeding their expectations, we are looking for you!¬†You can read more about Feedbackly on¬†our careers page.

About the position

As a Junior Customer Success Manager, we will¬†build a personal development plan together when you join the team. In the beginning, you will mostly be working with reactive customer support and documentation work while taking part in customer meetings and training sessions together with a more senior team member. You will not be expected to manage your own customers from day one, but you will provide valuable support and learn on the job what it takes to succeed in a more senior role later on in your career.¬†From day one, you will be working with real customers and learning their needs and pain points under the guidance of a senior member. Don‚Äôt worry, they‚Äôre awesome! (the customers we mean)

What you would be doing for the first 6-9 months:

Serve as the first point of contact and provide high-level customer service and support for B2B customers in our different support channels (chat, email, phone)
Help our product development team in product testing and documentation together with the rest of the team
Coordinate feedback terminal tasks together with Supply Chain Manager
Keep our self-service support channels and documentation up to date
Build relationships with key customers and team members
Give insight to our Customer Success Managers on customer contacts and requests
Assist our Customer Success Managers with tasks you will be expected to take care of on your own later on
Learn about CX and CS theory, SaaS Solutions, and our technical environment
Possibility to assist our sales reps with new customer acquisition
After about 6 months, you are able to consider yourself a Feedbackly product and value proposition veteran, after which you will start managing your own portfolio of customers, both existing and new customers transitioned from our sales team. You‚Äôll work to understand and set the customer experience goals of our customers, shepherd them through onboarding and training, and provide relevant best practices, content, and resources throughout their Feedbackly lifetime. You manage your own set of customers, minimizing churn and extending their use of Feedbackly based on the customer‚Äôs desired outcomes.

What we and our customers think would help you succeed in the role:

Skilled communicator ‚Äì you listen more than you talk
Consultative spirit
Trustworthy
Adaptable personality
High tolerance for uncertainty and incompleteness
Solution-oriented¬†
Team player who is capable of independent decision making as well
Compassionate/ emotionally intelligent
Spontaneous and productive
What we would appreciate you to have:

2-3 years of experience in Customer Experience, Customer Support or Sales is considered a big advantage
Experience in B2B SaaS business is considered an advantage
Experience in retail and/or eCommerce is a definite plus
Minimum Bachelor‚Äôs Degree in Business, Engineering, Marketing, or Management
Customer-centric mindset
Exceptional verbal and written communication skills (Finnish & English mandatory, other languages especially Nordic languages considered a plus)
Good presentation skills
Proactive leadership skills with customers
Desire to work in an ever-changing, experimental environment
Demonstrated ability to give and receive feedback and adapt quickly
Able to work in a multicultural environment
Self-learning
Why Feedbackly?

Customer Experience and high-quality feedback data will continue to be on the top of the list of companies and organizations around the world. Our internally developed KPI Emotional Value Index (EVI¬Æ) is something no one else has, so it gives us a clear-cut advantage in serving the CX megatrend on the market as well. The person joining our team will have an integral role in our global growth, and we are hiring this person for the long haul with a development path to bigger responsibilities and wider knowledge as we go along. You would also get to work with some big brands in Finland and globally, and help build a product and service that really makes a difference in the lives of people. We are a group of people learning and working together towards the same goal while having everyone benefit from the work through stock option programs and performance bonuses.

If you managed to get this far, you‚Äôre already ticking off one box ‚Äì patience and stamina üôÇ If you have a¬†couple of years of background in customer-facing roles either in sales or customer support¬†looking to jump into something new and exciting, this could be something for you! We would like to get the process ongoing with our new team member as soon as he/she/they is found, so hurry up and apply.

Can‚Äôt wait to meet you!

Please apply here as quickly as possible, the position is filled right as we find a good candidate:¬†https://www.feedbackly.com/contact/apply/

jobs.heading: F2F and D2D Fundraisers needed in Jyvaskyla ,Helsinki, Espoo ,Vantaa and other regions
jobs.descr:
We are looking for fundraisers in the Uusimaa and other  regions to join our team of fundraising.

We're waiting for you to join our happy and relaxed team. We have a job that can't be matched, a job that doesn't get off easy, but gives even more. As a Fundraiser, or F2F and D2D fundraiser, your job is to actively approach people  tell about the great work our partners do around the world to help children and make them to join organizations we represent as monthly donors.

Your contribution is very important, as with the help of monthly donors we ensure that we get help both at home and around the world  for children around the world for a better welfare.

At the moment we are looking for feissars in
Helsinki
Espoo
Vantaa,
Vaasa
Jyvaskyla
Tampere
¬†
From you, we expect a fair and positive mind,  and perseverance. Your job is to give a face and a voice to the organization and tell everyone about our work. 

At work, it is important to have the courage to be bold to be in contact with people, to explain things convincingly and to make the customer feel that even the smallest act is meaningful. In this way, we will have new monthly donors, with which our good work will continue 

A positive and open attitude will take you a long way
What we offer

Flexible working hours: Shifts can be worked from Monday to Saturday,
4-6 shifts per week, evening hours. You can influence your own working days and working hours. (4hrs to 6hrs a day)
You have the opportunity to work on at the doors and streets and malls
Competitive salary: We offer a salary of 11 ‚Ç¨ / h for the feissar, 12.50 ‚Ç¨ / h for the team leader. In addition, we pay a 9% holiday bonus.
Temporary employment offer could become permanent with time: Our new employment contracts are, in principle, Temporary, unless the matter is agreed separately with the employee. Summer working towns are on a fixed-term basis, with possible extensions to be permanent.
As an employee of the Nordic Promotions, we take priority in making sure our workers are working in a stable and condusive environment.
Support and training: You are supported by experienced coordinators and team leaders to get on board well and receive comprehensive, continuous training. You learn a lot about yourself as a turn influencer and you can also develop your existing interaction skills. This work teaches you even if you have a long and extensive work and life experience behind you.
Don't waste time. Apply now at nordicpromotions@europe.com
Or call 0465434204
We look foward to hearing from you

jobs.heading: Hitsaaja/Welder/Metal Fabricator
jobs.descr:
We are looking for Welder/ Metal Fabricator to join our driven and passionate team and become a valued part of the Steelcraft family.

The company:

Steelcraft Framing prides itself on delivering market-leading framing solutions which address the needs of an evolving residential housing market. We are growing strongly thanks to our fantastic team, word of mouth recommendations and a focus on supporting Queensland's best builders. Welcome to the Steelcraft team, we look forward to your valuable contribution to our journey and helping us make a positive difference.

Essential requirements¬†of your position are

Honesty, passion, and a positive attitude
Fabrication and welding experience with steel, MIG welding
Be able to interpret engineering drawings and specifications
‚ÄãAttention to detail and dedication to quality
To assist in training staff if and where required
Strong experience in steel fabrication
Forklift license
Interact with other departments to achieve successful project/job outcomes
Be competent to use a variety of power tools
Team worker
Have own transport and driver‚Äôs license
Advantageous skills

Ability to delegate, lead and motivate others
Strong assembly skills and understanding of mechanics
Excellent communication skills


Why Steelcraft?

We offer a great work environment and a unique opportunity to further your career. We value your input and appreciate that it is a great team that makes a great business. If this sounds like you apply now with your resume and a short cover letter.

jobs.heading: Avustava Tarjoilija Farang
jobs.descr:
We are looking for an enthusiastic and sunny to room attendant at Restaurant Farang for a part-time (average 60h / 3 weeks) employment. We expect the applicant to have at least a year of experience in the restaurant industry, a warm service attitude and teamwork skills. Working hours are in the evenings and on weekends

We especially value the desire to develop our own skills and the ability to adapt to changing situations. The quality of the product and service is of paramount importance to us, so we become thoroughly acquainted with the work. The work has a good chance of advancing to the duties of a waitress in the future.

We offer a diverse work environment with a stable staff base, the opportunity to work with top professionals in the field and to develop your own professional skills. Our company, which is growing its operations, has a great opportunity to develop its expertise and build a possible career path in our various operations.

Could you be the person we're looking for? If you feel the answer is yes, then we look forward to hearing from you! The search ends on May 10, 2022, but the task will be filled as soon as suitable people are found. So please send us your application as soon as possible via the attached application form!

jobs.heading: Internet Ads Assessor  - Work from home
jobs.descr:
In this job you will be reviewing online advertisements in order to improve their content, quality and layout. You will be required to provide feedback and analysis on advertisements found in search engine results and provide ratings on their relevance to the search terms used. Another aspect of this opportunity will involve reviewing the language used in advertisements by examining grammar, tone and cultural relevance.

Through this work you will be making a valuable contribution to the quality of online advertisements in Finland.

Who is suitable for this work?

We are looking for dynamic people who have strong communication skills and use the Internet daily. You should also be flexible, reliable and have the ability to interpret and follow established guidelines.¬†

You will need to have the flexibility and freedom to work from your own home, working your own hours. Hours for this opportunity are up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.

What are the main requirements for the opportunity?

You must be living in Finland for the last 3 consecutive years
You must have familiarity with current and historical business, media, sport, news, social media and cultural affairs in Finland
Fluency in English and Finnish
Access to and use of a broadband internet connection and associated computer and software to perform the work, all provided at your own expense
Experience in use of web browsers to navigate and interact with a variety of content
Access to and use of an Android (version 4.1 or higher) or IOS Smartphone (version 8 or higher) to complete tasks
A Barcode Scanner application must be installed on your smartphone to complete certain tasks
Active daily user of Gmail and other forms of Social Media

jobs.heading: Head of Global Community and HR
jobs.descr:
ABOUT THE ROLE:¬†

Ambitious.Africa, a fast-emerging global non-profit driving sustainable impact across youth communities in Africa and the Nordics, is seeking an impassioned, energetic, purpose-driven and results-oriented changemaker to join our growing organization as Head of Global Community and HR. In this role, you will be responsible for building and managing sustainable Ambitious Teams in Africa and the Nordics, engaging proactively with a global community, optimizing our recruitment funnel, coordinating a variety of community events and initiatives and communicating well with a wide range of stakeholders. You will gain¬†invaluable experiences in intercultural collaboration and data-driven leadership.¬†You will be part of the Global Team and report directly to the CEO.

ROLES AND RESPONSIBILITIES:

Lead by example, represent the interests of Ambitious.Africa
Organise engaging webinars, community events and meetups
Building and leading community on our new online ecosystem
Coordinating and reporting on regular meetings with Team Leads
Create innovative community events and produce insightful content
Inspire, engage, support young changemakers to lead and take action
Work closely with our global and national teams to champion our mission
Managing a cross-cultural community spread across Africa and the Nordics
Community outreach and documentation; sharing resources and networking
Formulation of planning, implementation and documentation of all HR activities
WHAT WE‚ÄôRE LOOKING FOR:

Strong people management skills
Engaging, outgoing, approachable personality
Outstanding communication skills, both written and verbal
Self-motivated; prepared to take the initiative; be proactive
Demonstrated ability to lead remote teams and achieve results
Enthusiastic, self-starter who values empathy and collaboration
Resilient and able to work in a fast-paced changing environment
Excellent community engagement and community building skills
Passion for meeting new people and creating meaningful connections
COMMITMENT:Minimum 6-month commitment

Must be available to work evenings and weekends

Availability to volunteer at least 10-15 hours a week
BENEFITS:

Volunteer Recognition Certificate
Learn valuable insights into different cultures
University credits (ECTs, Finnish Students only)
Volunteer experience to your CV and LinkedIn profile
Interacting with changemakers from 20+ different countries
Career acceleration in a highly dynamic work environment
Invaluable opportunity to play a key role in building the future
Connecting youth to knowledge, exciting opportunities and networks
Build a global network of young professionals, mentors and changemakers
This is a part-time, fully remote and unpaid position.

We‚Äôre the best at what we do and with you we can become even better. If you are interested in this role, please apply and we will get back to you shortly.

ABOUT AMBITIOUS AFRICA

Ambitious.Africa is the bridge between the African and Nordic youth who build the sustainable future together. We transform the collaboration between Africa and the Nordics by focusing on Education, Entrepreneurship, and Entertainment. We connect, inspire, and empower young people in all African and Nordic countries, to work together, lead the change, and make an impact. Ambitious.Africa's vision is based on three pillars of Education, Entrepreneurship, and Entertainment. These are the values that guide us towards our goals:

Collaboration:¬†We value collaboration - learning from each other and working together towards a better future.

Learning-by-doing:¬†We value learning, we think it is important to learn things and gain experience through active doing, not just thinking.

Leading the change:¬†We value proactive attitude, we want young people to be in charge and lead the change towards a better future.

Transparency:¬†We value transparency ‚Äì we base our decisions and actions on transparent and clear communication and decision-making processes.

Trust:¬†We value trust - we are trustworthy, and we trust others.

Accountability:¬†We value accountability and responsible attitude - we take accountability for our acts and decisions.

Openness:¬†We value open and honest communication.

jobs.heading: Partnerships Volunteer
jobs.descr:
Ambitious.Africa, a fast-emerging NGO driving sustainable impact across youth communities in Africa and the Nordics, is seeking a professional, reliable, enthusiastic and purpose-driven partnerships volunteer to join our growing organisation. Self-starter, fast learner with resourceful

¬†Work with an enthusiastic, diverse, and passionate team that‚Äôs building the future

We‚Äôre the best at what we do and with you we can become even better. If you are interested in this role, please apply and we will get back to you shortly.

jobs.heading: Marketing Executive
jobs.descr:
WHAT?

Are you a passionate marketer and would like to use your marketing skills to promote the Ambitious events, partnerships, and projects? Then this is the position for you! This position will provide you with invaluable experiences from leading the country-specific marketing operations of a fast-growing global non-profit.¬†


WHY?

The Marketing Executive is¬†in charge of marketing, social media, and outreach. We want to reach as many people and relevant organizations that can benefit from our events and projects as possible. Ambitious.Africa has essential marketing templates ready, but they need to be adapted to be country-specific by this person. This person is also in charge of communications, especially on social media.


WHAT ARE THE TASKS?

Create visuals (posters, banners, social media content) in line with brand assets (with the help of templates)
Create, distribute, and promote compelling content about the Ambitious Africa
Create marketing strategies and execute them
Collaborating with the Head of Media and Communications¬†

FOR WHO?

We value changemaker attitude, passion for creating a brighter future, and curiosity to learn more.¬†For this position marketing-related education and/or experience is an asset.¬†To succeed in this position, you should have:¬†

Excellent written communication skills in English
Creative and adaptive, organized attitude, ability to be detail-oriented while not losing sight of the big picture
Ability to organize and structure workload according to the team's needs
Availability to contribute to Ambitious.Africa at least 5-10 hours/week
Work is done on a voluntary basis.


WHAT WILL YOU GET?

Truly international and multicultural team and network
Opportunity to get responsibility and play a key role in building the future
Role-related mentoring from the best-of-the-best
Share your own posters and graphics to international audience
University credits (ECTs, Finnish Students only; African students
Please ask your university for more information on study credits¬† ¬†¬†
Volunteer experience to your CV and LinkedIn
Volunteering certificate

If you think it could be a match, don‚Äôt hesitate to contact us. We would love to hear more about you! Have an awesome day and we hope to hear from you soon!

Best regards,

Eustacia & the rest of the Ambitious Africa team¬†

ABOUT AMBITIOUS AFRICA

Ambitious.Africa is an initiative that aspires to be the bridge between the Nordics and Africa and our aims lay in connecting, inspiring, and empowering young people to help them make a change together. Ambitious.Africa's vision is based on three pillars of Education, Entrepreneurship, and Entertainment. These are the values that guide us towards our goals:

Collaboration¬†We value collaboration - learning from each other and working together towards a better future.

Learning-by-doing¬†We value learning, we think it is important to learn things and gain experience through active doing, not just thinking.

Leading the change¬†We value proactive attitude, we want young people to be in charge and lead the change towards a better future.

Transparency¬†We value transparency ‚Äì we base our decisions and actions on transparent and clear communication and decision-making process.

Trust¬†We value trust - we are trustworthy, and we trust others.

Accountability¬†We value accountability and responsible attitude - we take accountability for our acts and decisions.

Openness¬†We value open and honest attitude and communication.
