jobs.heading: Laboratory technician/lab operator
jobs.company_name: NRG Finland Nordic Retail Group Oy
jobs.descr:
Our customer, Microsoft looking for a Laboratory technician/lab operator to work in the HoloLens team in Espoo.

The Microsoft HoloLens hardware team is transforming the ways people communicate, create, and collaborate through the devices and components we develop. We‚Äôre a growing team of engineers on a mission to develop revolutionary designs and ship first-to-market products. Our team is creative and resourceful; we value growth and learning. We want to amplify your abilities so you can do your best work. Join us, and together we‚Äôll turn groundbreaking hardware designs into reality
We are looking for Technician/ Lab Operator to join our Advanced Optics Team. Working on Microsoft HoloLens you will be part of an organization which consists of professionals from the fields of optics, micro- and nanofabrication process technologies, and mechanical engineering. In this role you will be working hands-on with novel optical materials and their processing. This involves multi-step unique micro- and nanofabrication technologies and tools to ensure future production processes and equipment meet their targets for capability and quality. You will be working with cutting edge technologies with long term studies and process development. Your background in handling various types of chemistries with good sense of manufacturing and hands-on experience on micro- and nanofabrication methods as well as your desire for continuous improvement, learning and working in high-tech field will enable you to adopt our innovative manufacturing methods and help you to have an impact as we are engineering the future.

Tasks:
‚Ä¢	Participates in daily laboratory activities
‚Ä¢	Following and improving good chemistry working practices
‚Ä¢	Conduct experiments on new materials. 
‚Ä¢	Assisting in the testing and development of novel optical components. 
‚Ä¢	Monitoring the quality of materials and performing instrument quality control procedures
‚Ä¢	Documenting all procedures and possible deviations diligently
‚Ä¢	Laboratory chemical handling process maintenance and development 
‚Ä¢	Material test equipment maintenance and calibration with internal stakeholders and external vendors 

Requirements:
‚Ä¢	Degree of Laboratory technician (Laborantti) / B.Sc. level degree in Chemistry
‚Ä¢	1-3 years‚Äô experience in laboratory work
‚Ä¢	Proactive working attitude and good collaboration skills
‚Ä¢	Proven ability to learn and adopt new techniques quickly
‚Ä¢	Good computer skills, including Microsoft Office
‚Ä¢	Good communication skill in English: Oral and written, Finnish advantage

The person will be employed for NRG on a fixed-term contract, first contract period until Dec 31st then extended, total length of 18 months.
‚Ä¢	Start date: April 
‚Ä¢	Location: Espoo
‚Ä¢	Monthly salary: between 3000-3200 euros, depending on experience

About Nordic Retail Group 
Nordic Retail Group is a full-service retail agency, founded in 1997 and is represented in all four Nordic countries. We focus on helping our clients build their brands and reach their goals by offering staffing, recruitment, creative studio, and innovative inventions for our clients. We have built a strong team and we know what‚Äôs needed for a brand to succeed in retail, and how to increase sales both locally and globally. 
The work environment at Nordic Retail Group is creative and energetic and we‚Äôre always eager to go the extra mile to succeed. We truly have a passion for people, that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important for us to offer the most safe, inclusive, and inspiring workplace that we possibly can for our amazing employees. 
 
We highly value having a diverse team with different types of experiences and backgrounds included in the mix. It‚Äôs important to us that everyone feels valued, appreciated and like an important part of our team. Most importantly, we want our staff to love coming to work. Like our founders always says: ‚ÄúYou should not only whistle on your way home from the office ‚Äì but also on your way to the office.‚Äù 
 
Visit our website www.nordicretailgroup.com for more information.

jobs.heading: Earthworks professionals
jobs.descr:
Georam Oy is a young and growing earthworks and landscaping company operating in Helsinki-Uusimaa Region. We employ 30 professionals, and every year we execute the earthworks and landscaping for hundreds of clients, including several large construction companies. 

We are looking for earthworks professionals to work as labourers and excavator operators. With us, you will be working in our sites in Helsinki-Uusimaa Region. Our services include the whole process of earthworks from logging trees to excavating foundations and landscaping the yards, so there will be a wide variety of versatile tasks available.

We hope you are a self-starter who already has some experience from this field and will be able to work relatively independently (but always as part of the team!). Finnish is not required in these jobs as long as you have sufficient English skills. 

From excavator operators we hope previous experience with 3D equipment and excavating foundations. 

We offer our employees fair pay (15 ‚Äì 22 ‚Ç¨/h depending on your skill, experience and effort) and fair treatment, quality tools to work with and possibility to progress in your career. We believe in rewarding hard work and motivation ‚Äì with us, you can go from handyman to foreman. If necessary, we will help you acquire your Occupational Safety Card.

Interested? Send a free-form application to jesse.tauriainen@georam.fi and tell us a little bit about yourself and your work history. Be quick - positions will be filled as soon as we find the right candidates!

jobs.heading: Sales support - Finnish speaking
jobs.company_name: NRG Finland Nordic Retail Group Oy
jobs.descr:
On behalf of our client, a well-known iconic software company in Espoo, we are looking for a Finnish speaking Sales support.

Tasks

Partner closely with the local sales teams
Manage Finland local budget in collaboration with local finance.
Support the operations team in driving compliance and process execution.
Drive communications¬†and process updates.
Coordinate rhythm of business in local subsidiary.
Support process tools and resources
Local training and readiness (new hires, refresh training).
Support with marketing spend management, accruals follow-up and reporting.
Support and readiness with marketing PO creation as needed.
Drive local compliance topics for the segment.
Requirements

We are looking for someone that is early in their career with a passion for technology and innovation.
Ability to manage numerous activities, prioritize and adapt to urgent operational needs.
Very process-driven with high attention to detail.
Problem solver with an attention to detail.
Strong communicator and collaborator.
Bachelor's degree (B.S./B.A.) required and/or experience in relevant fields e.g.: business, operations, finance, information technology, marketing.
Comfortable working in a team as well as independently.
Self-motivated, comfortable working with ambiguity and managing complexity in a global, fast-paced organization.
Previous experience with CRM systems preferred but not required.
Strong Excel skills (e.g. Pivots, dimensional modeling), fluency in MS PowerPoint, OneNote, and PowerBI preferred but not required.
Willingness and ability to self-learn.
Fluent in English and Finnish.
Other

The person will be employed for NRG on a fixed-term contract of 18 months, first contract period until Dec 31st, then extended.

Start date: May

Monthly salary: between 2900 ‚Äì 3470 euros/month depending on experience

Location: Espoo + remote

Please note that we will start interviews as soon as possible after, so register on our website with application, CV in¬†English¬†and arguments why you would be the best possible candidate for this assignment. For more information please contact Mari Torstila in Finland at torstila (at) nordicretailgroup.com.


About Nordic Retail Group

Nordic Retail Group is a full-service retail agency, founded in 1997 and is represented in all four Nordic countries. We focus on helping our clients build their brands and reach their goals by offering staffing, recruitment, creative studio, and innovative inventions for our clients. We have built a strong team and we know what‚Äôs needed for a brand to succeed in retail, and how to increase sales both locally and globally.

The work environment at Nordic Retail Group is creative and energetic and we‚Äôre always eager to go the extra mile to succeed. We truly have a passion for people, that‚Äôs why it‚Äôs so important for us to offer the most safe, inclusive, and inspiring workplace that we possibly can for our amazing employees.

We highly value having a diverse team with different types of experiences and backgrounds included in the mix. It‚Äôs important to us that everyone feels valued, appreciated and like an important part of our team. Most importantly, we want our staff to love coming to work. Like our founders always says: ‚ÄúYou should not only whistle on your way home from the office ‚Äì but also on your way to the office.‚Äù

Visit our website¬†www.nordicretailgroup.com¬†for more information.

jobs.heading: Sales Agent - Swedish speaking
jobs.descr:
We are looking¬†for a Sales Agent - Swedish Speaking who is passionate about working on commissions and wants to control his/her own salary. As a sales agent, you will work with our client's potential customers over the telephone. You will show an interest to learn how to invest. You will then help them register their accounts and start investing on our client's platform. If you have a private interest or experience in finance, it is a merit but not a must as our client offer¬†on-site¬†training. You are self-sufficient, responsible and have good cooperative ability and master Swedish at a fluent level. You will be part of a dynamic and hungry team that works towards both group goals and their own personal goals every month.

ABOUT OUR CLIENT

Our client is an outsourcing company who¬†specializes in financial services and client relations¬†and is located in St. Julian's.

REQUIREMENTS AND SKILLS
¬†
- Previous experience in sales would be a plus.
- Fluency in Swedish is a must.
- Good knowledge of English.
- Excellent communication ability and being able to meet all types of people.
- Good at customer contact and accommodating.
- Be able to work and deliver under pressure.

EDUCATION

- A Bachelor's degree¬†in Economics / Finance.

WORKING TIME

- Monday to Thursday from 10:00 to 19:00 and Friday from 09:00 to 18:00 with 1 hour break.

SALARY AND BENEFITS

- ‚Ç¨18K p.a. plus commissions.¬†¬†
- Monthly performance Bonus.
- Up-to 1 month accommodation, in the company shared apartment/room. (Relevant to relocators)
- Reimbursement for arrival flight ticket, after completing three months working within the company. Budget is up to EUR 200.
- Education, training, tools and a fantastic opportunity for a career in the financial sector.
- Medical insurance.
- Office fruits & snacks on daily basis.
- Food allowance after three months working within the company.
- Benefits and discounts at local gym, cafes and also with some real estate agencies to ease housing.
- Open to company‚Äôs employees regular sport activities: Padel/football and such.
- Large extra incentives budget which comes in affect through internal or global office's competitions, themes activities, and other fun events.
- Super fun international environment; 300 employees in a huge open floor offices setup.
- 300 sunny days per year in Malta.

If you meet the requirements and feel that this position is a fit for you, do not hesitate and apply for this role today!

ABOUT IRIS THAUMAS

IRIS THAUMAS LTD is certified to ISO 9001:2015; licensed Employment Agency/Employment Business (EA #181); and Certified SRPS (MLC 2006 SRPS).

jobs.descr:
Orange, delicious, surely the slowest moving thing on the road. We are Ape Gelato and we provide a holistic, authentic Italian experience to the people in the streets of Helsinki in the form of locally produced, delicious gelato and espresso. 
 
If you see yourself as a relentless, energetic salesperson with no fear to overcome any obstacle, you might have just found your dream job!

We are offering you a great position to shine as the next gelato star. The sale takes place with the ‚Äústreet food‚Äù concept, driving Ape around different locations in the heart of Helsinki. In addition to selling ice cream, the job description includes cleaning, transporting the vehicle and creating catchy content on social media. We offer competitive salary (ranging between 12-14 EUR / hour) and a unique and interesting working atmosphere full of courage, collaboration and of course a lot of fun!

The ideal applicant would have a working Finnish driving license (class A1 or B is required!), experience in working previously in a kiosk or ice cream shop, a hygiene pass, fluent English and basic knowledge of Finnish (minimum for gelato words!) and a fearless attitude.
 
As our working language is both English and Finnish, please write a cover letter in English and inform us about your Finnish and English proficiency levels. We are looking for both full time (approx 30-35h / week) and partial time (15-30h / week) workers who would preferrably be able to start already in May! Please do inform us about your availability with you cover letter.

If you see yourself as a great candidate, don't hesitate to contact us at aperecruit2022@gmail.com PLEASE NOTE that we will prioritize applications arriving to us early. In other words, do not wait until the deadline! :)

Find more details of what we do and our team through our Instagram @apegelato and Facebook @apegelatosuomi. What is like working with us? Hear it from our 2021 team members! (paste and copy the link) https://youtu.be/UYocU6Y40pc

Ape team looks forward to hearing from you, good luck!

jobs.heading: Restaurant Manager | MUJI Restaurant
jobs.descr:
What is MUJI?
 MUJI's story started in Japan in 1980, as a response to the habits of commercial consumer society at the time. The vision to bring ‚ÄòNo Brand, Quality Goods‚Äô -short for "Mujirushi¬†Ryohin" turned into reality overseas for the first time in 1991 in London, when MUJI opened the very first store outside of Japan. Over 28 years since then, we continued to grow to now more than 1000 stores across the globe, employing and serving millions of customers, and being recognized¬† as a game-changer by our design, simplicity and quality.
¬†¬†
 MUJI Restaurant is a charming and homy combination of restaurant, caf√©, bar and local food store. It¬†is a meeting place for city locals and is combining Japanese flavors, local ingredients and delicious pastries. MUJI Restaurant in Finland is the first in Europe and was opened in November 2019, and is located in the 4th floor in Kamppi Shopping Center in connection with to MUJI store. We¬†have 199 seatings and we currently service lunch.



We are looking for a RESTAURANT MANAGER to our young team

 What do we expect from you?


Previous experience of managing restaurant team and building up a professional team
Ability and drive to develop MUJI Restaurant concept following and understanding MUJI company direction
You will be in charge of sales and operational leading
You should have comprehensive understanding of restaurant figures and operational systems (we use Restolution)
Have pride to your work
You should have great communication skills, be outgoing and extrovert¬†¬†
We expect you to lead by example, be supportive¬†towards your team members and show how to work effectively
A warm-hearted customer service is your second nature
You have a passion for restaurant industry, you are willing to learn more and make the best out of your team
We expect you to lead by example, be positive and flexible


¬†
What do we offer for you?


Ability to develop MUJI Restaurant and its' selection further together with the team
Young, energetic and passioned work community
Competitive salary starting from 3500‚Ç¨ (negotiable)
Comprehensive occupational health care service
Ideal working hours (mainly day time)
Big company benefits such as lunch benefit, culture and sport benefit, staff discount of MUJI products


¬†
Did you get excited?¬†
 Position is fulltime 112,5h / 3 weeks and starts as soon as the right candidate is found. Please send your application and CV with salary expectation as soon as possible but latest on 22th of May 2022. We will start interviews already during application period and will contact all candidates latest during week 21.

 We look forward receiving your application!

¬†We are hiring: Teacher of Arabic¬†¬†

With brilliant track record of delivering high quality education in Finland, Joutsenon Opisto enjoys a great reputation as one of the organisations delivering liberal education in languages and arts. As a step towards the expansion of our Arabic language programme, Joutsenon Opisto is currently seeking an Arabic teacher to be part of its active and vibrant teaching staff.¬†

The Arabic language teacher will be responsible for the delivery of quality Arabic language and culture courses to our current students and potential external clients.¬†

Responsibilities¬†

Delivering best educational practise aimed at developing language skills in learners,¬†
Creating engaging and effective learner centred lesson plans,¬†
Assessing the students‚Äô progress and adjusting programme accordingly and/providing recommendations to that effect,¬†
Encouraging a climate of communication that boosts mutual cultural understanding and tolerance,¬†
Liaising with the school‚Äôs external partners to facilitate the delivery of high-quality content,¬†
Performing other administrative duties related to the position.¬†
Requirements¬†

Passion and motivation for teaching and learning with an open mind for the new developments in the field,¬†
Related qualification (Minimum of master‚Äôs degree) in the area of Arabic language teaching (included but not limited to Teaching Arabic as a Foreign Language/Applied linguistics, etc.) from an accredited university,¬†
Educated native or near-native proficiency in Arabic and an excellent command of standard Arabic,¬†
Sound and demonstratable experience in developing, implementing, and reviewing language programmes,¬†
Experience of teaching Arabic to adults preferably in the context of second or foreign language,¬†
Acceptable levels of computer literacy and experience of applying educational technologies in delivering lessons using different online/offline digital solutions/sources,¬†
Experience of teaching Arabic within the Finnish context is an advantage.¬†
If you consider yourself a professional who would like to make a difference while working at a highly reputable educational organisation, send your expression of interest along with your CV (English/Finnish/Arabic) to ‚Ä¶.@joutsenonopisto.fi no later than DATE.¬†

For more information, you can also call 000000 or use the email address above.¬†

Shortlisted applicants will be asked to attend an interview and perform a teaching demonstration.¬†

Located in the close vicinity of Saimaa Lake, Joutsenon Opisto has been delivering high quality education for over 70 years. In addition to its great educational facilities, it has dormitories, a canteen offering three meals a day, a gym, recreation rooms, and lots of beautiful open spaces around it!¬†

Joutsenon Opisto is CAF accredited institution and has different partnerships with the University of Jyvaskyla, University of Eastern Finland, Turku University, and Helsinki University in Finland. It also has overseas partnerships with Schumacher College in the UK and Hamed Bin Khalifeh University in Qatar.¬†

More information about Joutsenon Opisto can be found at www.joutsenonopisto.fi
